p: In a previous study of hepatitis C, we found that in contrast to amplicon-based sequencing, veSEQ was quantitative, in that total Illumina read-pairs correlated with clinical viral loads ( 25). To confirm that veSEQ was similarly quantitative for HIV, we performed both clinical viral load measurements and veSEQ-HIV sequencing on 146 specimens. Figure 2A shows the correlation between the routine clinically validated viral load and number of viral fragments recovered during sequencing, along with the R 2 value (0.89). This correlation was robust over a wide range of viral loads ( Fig. 2B) that includes the quantifiable limit of the clinical assay (<50 copies/ml).
